N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 9500.8 - Notice of defect

State Regulations
(a) The trust
shall have 15 calendar days after receipt of an invoice at the appropriate
designated payment office to notify the contractor of: (1)
defects or incompleteness in the
delivered goods, property or services; (2)
defects or incompleteness in the invoice
or voucher; or
(3)
suspected
improprieties of any kind. (b) The notice of defect shall include the
reasons that the trust believes that a defect or impropriety exists. (c) Whenever a proper notice of defect is
given to a contractor, the required payment date shall be 45 calendar days, after any defect or incompleteness in an invoice or voucher or in delivered
goods, property or services or any suspected impropriety shall be
rectified. (d) If the trust fails to
issue a notice of defect within 15 days of the receipt of invoice, the payment
period shall be reduced by the number of days between the 15th day after the
receipt of the invoice and the date of notification. (e) Effective January 1, 1989, the required
payment date shall be 30 calendar days, excluding legal holidays, after the
correction of any defect or impropriety. Notes
